page.title: 11Farming in general
page.content: The{clay soils}in this block can be used to support most types of farming. The{arable}tends to be on the west side of the block and the{livestock farming in the east. It is a{breeding area for cattle, deer, llama and game birds. The arable farming is highly mechanised and it is a rush to harvest, plough and replant before the soil becomes too wet to work. Once a crop is established it does well because the clay holds the moisture in dry spells. The smaller farms are taken over by{smallholders}who, with their families manage to make a living. There are two developments which might change farming patterns and these are: the introduction of{organic farming}(at Belmordean) and the imposition of the uncertainties of {EEC milk quotas}- several farms are finding profitability handicapped.
